column4: does anyone use the full encryption from the alternate install cd?
is it a good idea to use full encryption on a laptop?
well i just loaded 12.04 on my new laptop but should I encrypt it? I was told you had to use the alternate install cd to fully encrypt the whole system not just /home
You will need to use the alternative install cd to do so, unless you want to make it more complicated.

However unless you're expecting to store sensitive information on your machine, Full Disk Encryption isn't usually needed :) I'd recommend getting more experience with Linux in general before delving into Encryption Schemes.
I know encryption is good if it gets stolen, but what if I break something and it won't boot? is it better just to encrypt /home

A strong enough initial password should protect your information readily enough, if they are indeed sophisticated enough to get through normal authentication measures such encryption usually won't help. However you can encrypt /home if you feel you need to.
thanks, I'm a worst case person, I'm thinking more along the lines of if you pull the drive an mount it to another system.
If you query me I can help you set it up if you'd like :)
I may run the alternate installer just to see how it works. it's a new machine so i'm not too vested at this point yet.
what about btrfs? have you tried it yet?
No I have no, I stick to Ext4 for partitions other than /boot and swap.
I made one partition for swap one for / and one for /home. Is it better to make /boot it's own?
It depends on your encryption scheme :)
Mine is a little more complex. I use one where /boot is on it's own among other things.
